title: Software Engineer, Infrastructure
job_description:

As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work on complex technical problems, build new features, and improve existing products across various platforms, including mobile devices and web applications. Our teams are constantly pushing the boundaries of user experience, and we're looking for passionate individuals who can help us advance the way people connect globally. If you're interested in joining a world-class team of industry veterans and working on exciting projects that have a significant impact, we encourage you to apply.

Implement custom user interfaces using latest programming techniques and technologies
Develop reusable software components for interfacing with back-end platforms
Analyze and optimize code for quality, efficiency, and performance
Lead complex technical or product efforts and provide technical guidance to peers

Identify and resolve performance and scalability issues
Work on a variety of coding languages and technologies

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience
6+ years of programming experience in a relevant language or 3+ years of experience + PhD
Track record of setting technical direction for a team, driving consensus and successful cross-functional partnerships
Experience building maintainable and testable code bases, including API design and unit testing techniques

6+ years relevant experience building large-scale infrastructure applications or similar experience
Experience with scripting languages such as Python, Javascript or Hack
Experience designing, analyzing and improving efficiency, scalability, and stability of various system resources
Experience owning a component, feature or system
Experience building and shipping high quality work and achieving high reliability
Experience improving quality through thoughtful code reviews, appropriate testing, proper rollout, monitoring, and proactive changes

title: Product Design Engineer
job_description:
At Reality Labs we aim to bring together cross-disciplinary minds in one place to deliver on our mission: build tools that help people feel connected, anytime, anywhere. As a Product Design Engineer, you will take a critical role in developing hardware systems for VR, AR, or New Technology Initiatives. You will become part of a team exploring developing concepts through prototyping and into mass-production consumer electronics. You will work as part of a cross functional team requiring collaboration in domains other than mechanical engineering. Our teams support mechanical engineering fundamentals, prototyping skills, CAD fluency, manufacturing process knowledge, and experience designing consumer electronics.
Product Design Engineer Responsibilities
Lead the mechanical design for a particular component, feature or system while having end-to-end product development understanding
Contribute to mechanical solutions as part of a highly cross-functional team
Model, build, test, and refine prototypes and characterization test systems
Work across the full product development cycle, from concept inception to shipping product
Collaborate and manage work with Asia-based Supply Chain
Push state-of-the-art technologies and approaches to solving complex mechanical problems while working with cross functional technical teams
Travel to external vendors up to 20%
Minimum Qualifications
BS in Mechanical Engineering
8+ years of industry experience in mechanical design
Experience in Design for Manufacturability (DFM), Design for Assembly (DFA), statistical tolerance analysis techniques, functional dimensioning, geometric tolerancing, and 3D/2D CAD
Working knowledge in material properties, such as plastics, metal, adhesive, glass, etc
Testing and analysis experience (FEA, Simulation, Design of Experiments, etc.)
Knowledge of high-volume manufacturing techniques (stamping, machining, injection molding, etc.)
Preferred Qualifications
10+ years of product design and development experience of handheld and/or wearable electronics for high volume manufacturing, including full systems ownership
MS or PhD in Mechanical Engineering
Experience designing handheld and wearable electronics for high volume manufacturing
Experience with NX
Experience with products cosmetic surface treatments and interfacing with industrial design teams
Mandarin and/or Cantonese language skills
Experience designing for human factors

title: Global Workplace Services (GWS) Supplier Program Manager
job_description:
Our Central Operations team collaborates with a variety of groups to enable seamless global operations. Our mission is to provide integrated services across Global Workplace Services (GWS), enhancing efficiency, optimizing resources, and delivering strategic solutions at scale. As a Supplier Program Manager, you will work closely with cross-functional internal stakeholders to identify business needs, streamline and optimize purchasing processes, and manage supplier deliverables across a range of indirect spend categories. These categories include, but are not limited to, goods procurement, software licensing, professional services, equipment, business operations outsourcing, general construction, and repair and maintenance.
Global Workplace Services (GWS) Supplier Program Manager Responsibilities
Serve as the primary point of contact for suppliers and stakeholders, managing day-to-day communications, inquiries, and escalations to ensure collaborative relationships
Drive accountability and maximize value from suppliers by classifying, rationalizing, and optimizing the supplier portfolio, with a focus on managing strategic suppliers and partnerships
Organize and facilitate regular meetings between suppliers and internal business stakeholders to align goals, expectations, and performance
Monitor and evaluate supplier’s performance using robust reporting frameworks, tracking Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and compliance with service level agreements (SLAs)
Develop, maintain, and present supplier scorecards and dashboards tailored to various audiences, providing actionable insights to leadership and stakeholders
Identify areas for improvement with stakeholders in supplier services, lead remediation activities when performance issues arise, and drive continuous improvement initiatives
Ensure all supplier activities adhere to company policies and regulatory standards, proactively developing and implementing risk mitigation plans for critical and preferred suppliers
Collaborate with internal teams, including finance, operations, and risk management—to identify, monitor, and mitigate supplier-related risks such as financial viability, information security, business continuity, and regulatory compliance
Manage the entire supplier’s lifecycle, from onboarding—including documentation collection, verification, training, and orientation to company policies and processes—through ongoing relationship management and performance oversight
Support business improvement initiatives and process optimization projects, working closely with cross-functional teams to implement best practices in supplier management
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to analyze data to assess supplier performance, resolve conflicts, and drive results that support organizational objectives
Cultivate expertise in supplier management principles and best practices
Minimum Qualifications
5+ years in strategic relationship management, including hands-on experience managing third-party service delivery and supplier relationships
Have commercial awareness and understanding of various business models and operational environments
Advanced project management skills, with a proven track record of managing multiple projects and stakeholders in deadline-focused, ambiguous settings
Ability to analyze complex data, break down issues into actionable work streams, and resolve conflicts independently
Highly organized, action-oriented, and accountable for driving outcomes and following up on feedback to ensure positive results
Interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to build trust and influence stakeholders
Effective facilitation skills, with experience leading group discussions, driving collaboration, and communicating clearly across teams
Experience influencing operational changes and maximizing adoption of new ideas, tools, and practices across organizations
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and Google Suite applications
Think both strategically and tactically, adapting to evolving business needs and priorities
Demonstrate expert organizational, communication, and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and lead projects effectively

title: Optical Additive Manufacturing Materials Process Engineer
job_description:
We are seeking an experienced product and manufacturing engineer with experience in lens industrial manufacturing processes (e.g., anti-reflective coating, lamination, wet coating processes etc.) to drive product validation, development from concept to mass production in Asia together with manufacturing vendors and suppliers. The candidate will have demonstrated knowledge of materials, manufacturing processes, process risks, and quality control, along with a proven track record in launching industrial products through collaboration with Chinese vendors and contract manufacturers (CMs).

You will serve as the technical bridge between global R&D and local manufacturing, ensuring process robustness, quality, and scalability throughout the end-to-end process flow.
Optical Additive Manufacturing Materials Process Engineer Responsibilities
Lead product development/scaling up in China, ensuring seamless integration of materials, processes, and quality control while working closely with local vendors, contract manufacturers, and global teams
Drive process optimization for lens manufacturing (e.g., anti-reflective coating, lamination, wet processes) to improve yield, efficiency, and quality at supplier/CM sites
Conduct on-site technical reviews with vendors to troubleshoot process issues, qualify materials, and validate production readiness
Identify and mitigate process risks in manufacturing, ensuring robust and scalable production through PFMEA and other methodologies
Collaborate with global R&D, engineering, production teams, and Chinese suppliers to understand product requirements and translate them into manufacturable solutions
Develop and execute proof-of-concept (POC) projects, exploring materials and processes to enhance product performance
Work closely with suppliers and equipment vendors to evaluate new technologies for lens manufacturing
Lead design for manufacturability (DFM) reviews to ensure smooth transition from prototype to mass production
Establish quality control standards and process validation protocols to meet industry and customer specifications together with vendors
Support new product introductions (NPI), troubleshooting process issues during ramp-up and ensuring on-time delivery
Travel extensively (more than 60% within China) to CM/supplier sites for process validation, troubleshooting, and production support
Stay updated on emerging trends in lens materials, coatings, and advanced manufacturing technologies
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor in Materials Science and Engineering, Chemistry or related field
5+ years in lens, optical products or consumer electronics manufacturing with expertise in coatings, lamination, wet processes, and curing technologies
Proven experience working with Chinese vendors/CMs - familiarity with local supply chain dynamics is a must
Demonstrated experience of understanding of product requirements, material properties, and process-materials-property-performance relationships
Hands-on experience with process development, scale-up, and quality control in an industrial setting
Mindset and skills to think out-of-the-box for POC development while maintaining a detail-oriented approach
Big-picture thinking - ability to align technical decisions with business and product launch goals
Demonstrated experience of problem-solving, project management, and cross-functional collaboration skills
Demonstrated experience in failure mode analysis, root cause investigation, and problem solving for product yield and quality issues
Experience in design reviews, tolerance analysis, and FMEA and DFM reviews
Professional working proficiency in Mandarin and English (technical and business-level) is a must
Willingness to travel frequently (up to 60%) across China
Preferred Qualifications
Master/ Ph.D. in materials science and engineering or equivalent field
Experience on hard coating and anti-reflective coating process is a big plus
Experience with inkjet deposition, UV-curable 3D printing, or other advanced coating technologies
Experience of high-precision equipment design and manufacturing based on process and materials requirement
Broad network and experience in lens/optical component-related materials industry
Experience of working with teams located in Europe
Experience in traditional ophthalmic industry
Experience in the consumer electronics industry, especially focus on materials engineering and process
Experience launching products into mass production - NPI experience is a big plus

job_description:
Creative X is a global, integrated creative agency that drives the creative vision for our brands and how they are perceived in the world. We develop the vision for next-generation creative advertising, consumer brand content and experiences for Meta, Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and our hardware products.

Our vision is fearless creativity that shapes the future of connection. With some of the industry’s best talent on our team, we create beautiful work that has a purpose. And with an audience of almost five billion across some of the world’s biggest brands, we create brave ideas that demonstrate the full creative potential of our platforms, including industry leading, envy-inducing creative experiences that push the boundaries of traditional advertising.

We believe in attracting and nurturing industry-leading talent with a focus on community and career development. We have developed best-in-class collaboration models with agencies and our cross-company creative network to ensure a consistent and effective creative narrative for work that reaches an audience across the globe due to the scale of our products. 

We are looking for a resourcing manager to support resourcing and developing scalable teams from a broad range of experiences, perspectives and backgrounds. Support the onboarding and immersion of new hires

5+ years of experience working in resource management at a creative agency, production studio or client side
Experience working with and navigating marketing and creative organizations
Experience in Resource Management tools such as Monday.com, JIRA, Asana and/or Workfront
Experience managing and onboarding freelancers, vendors, agencies, or contractors
Experience setting priorities, problem-solving, multitasking and working in a rapidly changing environment
Experience understanding end-to-end creative & marketing process
